title: Quiz: Real-World Projects
description: Final comprehensive quiz covering all JavaScript topics and project experience

questions.question: What is the most important skill when building a real-world JavaScript application?
questions.explanation: Breaking down problems, debugging, and understanding fundamentals are key to real-world development.

questions.question: Which practice helps maintain code quality in a team?
questions.explanation: Code reviews catch bugs, share knowledge, and enforce standards.

questions.question: What should you do before deploying a project?
options: Test thoroughly, check security, optimize performance
Skip testing if it works locally
questions.explanation: Always test, audit security, and optimize before production deployment.

questions.question: How do you handle errors in production?
options: Use try-catch, log errors, and monitor with tools like Sentry
questions.explanation: Catch errors, log them for debugging, and show user-friendly messages.

questions.question: What is progressive enhancement?
options: Start with core functionality, add advanced features if supported
questions.explanation: Progressive enhancement ensures basic functionality works everywhere, then enhances for capable browsers.

questions.question: Why is accessibility important?
options: Make web usable for everyone, including assistive tech users
questions.explanation: Accessibility ensures people with disabilities can use your site; it's ethical, legal, and good UX.

questions.question: What is a design pattern you would use for a state-heavy app?
questions.explanation: Observer/Pub-Sub pattern decouples components by having them subscribe to state changes.

questions.question: How do you manage dependencies in a long-lived project?
options: Lock versions (package-lock.json), update regularly, test after updates
questions.explanation: Pinning versions ensures reproducibility; regular updates bring security fixes and new features but require testing.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a README?
options: Document project: what, why, how to use, install, contribute
questions.explanation: README gives essential information about the project for users and contributors.

questions.question: What mindset should you have when learning a new technology?
options: Build projects, read docs, experiment, and share knowledge
questions.explanation: Active learning through building, experimenting, and teaching is the most effective.
